Comments_List: I improved my piano skills.
I made significant progress as a musician as I continued to work on developing my technique, especially breath support.

-trombone performance
-looks into extended techniques & embouchure 
-musicianship
Working on phrasing, technique and musicality in Introduction and Rondo Capriccioso, scales, orchestra excerpts and more.
How to sing correctly and better
I learned a lot about myself as a person and as a singer. I learned lots of new repertoire and also focused a bit on my technique.

I furthered my technique a lot in my lessons. Through great feedback, I was able to improve my bow technique, making it more fluid. Through the semester I was able to gain a sense control of my technique.
Voice lessons are a great way to improve your technique and gain confidence in singing!
More performance opportunities would be nice.
I can't think of any weaknesses for this course.  My teacher was always very helpful, and I was motivated to practice hard.

-good teacher & structure
-could be improved with more performance opportunity
Individual lessons and studio lessons were extremely helpful and effective.
I feel like this doesn't really apply to this

While I found working with a grad student to be helpful, I think having a teacher in the grad school for undergraduate violists would be great. My student teacher was very accomplished and had great insights in technique, but its hard to replicate the instruction that an experienced faculty member can give.
I wish there was less emphasis on repertoire and more on technique. I learned so much about technique and it sometimes felt like having to prepare so many songs for jury got in the way of learning.
Yes, lessons for credit are a good way to improve.
Yes, I would recommend this class because credit lessons are always an excellent opportunity to improve musical skills and to stay motivated to practice.
-yes, if they want to improve their ability to play trombone
Yes! Lessons are crucial to keeping up with violin in a meaningful and rigorous way.
Yesssss. Especially if you've never had singing training before, you will get soooo much better at singing. Easy credit, low time commitment, huge improvement. Totally worth.
Yes; if you are looking to improve your technique on your instrument, the best way to do that is through private lessons.
Yes! It's such a great way to improve technique, control and confidence!
